content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: TAETORD
      operator: not_exists
    - name: EPOCH
      operator: not_exists
    - name: --STDTC
      operator: not_exists
    - name: --ENDTC
      operator: not_exists
    - name: --DTC
      operator: not_exists
    - name: --STDY
      operator: not_exists
    - name: --ENDY
      operator: not_exists
    - name: --DY
      operator: not_exists
    - name: --DUR
      operator: not_exists
    - name: --TPT
      operator: not_exists
    - name: --TPTNUM
      operator: not_exists
    - name: --REPNUM
      operator: not_exists
    - name: --STRF
      operator: not_exists
    - name: --STRTPT
      operator: not_exists
    - name: --STTPT
      operator: not_exists
    - name: --ENRF
      operator: not_exists
    - name: --ENRTPT
      operator: not_exists
    - name: --ENTPT
      operator: not_exists
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SDTMIG.CG0219
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: In general, all domains based on the three general observation classes
  should have at least one Timing variable.
Outcome:
  Message: No timing variable present in dataset.
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Dataset
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0219
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: Timing variables (SDTM Table 2.2.5) are an essential
                  component of all SDTM subject-level domain datasets. In general,
                  all domains based on the three general observation classes should
                  have at least one Timing variable. In the Events or Interventions
                  general observation class, this could be the start date of the event
                  or intervention. In the Findings observation class, where data are
                  usually collected at multiple visits, at least one Timing variable
                  must be used.
                Document: IG v3.4
                Section: '4.4'
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - INTERVENTIONS
      - FINDINGS
      - EVENTS
  Domains:
    Exclude:
      - IE
      - SC

json.Description: In general, all domains based on the three general observation classes should have at least one Timing variable.

Outcome.Message: No timing variable present in dataset.

Citations.Cited_Guidance: Timing variables (SDTM Table 2.2.5) are an essential component of all SDTM subject-level domain datasets. In general, all domains based on the three general observation classes should have at least one Timing variable. In the Events or Interventions general observation class, this could be the start date of the event or intervention. In the Findings observation class, where data are usually collected at multiple visits, at least one Timing variable must be used.
